meanings.definition: Believers in the theory that organisms develop from preexisting miniature versions of themselves.
meanings.sent1: The preformationists studied tiny models to understand how organisms grow.
meanings.sent2: Many preformationists believed that living things start as small replicas of themselves.
meanings.sent3: The preformationists joked that they could find a tiny person inside every seed.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden where the seeds of ideas grew like preformationists in waiting.
meanings.sent5: In their minds, the preformationists saw a world of miniature possibilities.

meanings.definition: Advocates of the idea that all living things were created fully formed and have existed since the beginning of time.
meanings.sent1: The preformationists argued that every creature was made perfect from the start.
meanings.sent2: Some preformationists believed that life emerged fully developed from the start.
meanings.sent3: The preformationists playfully claimed they were born with all their knowledge intact.
meanings.sent4: His words were like preformationists, fully formed and ready to take on the world.
meanings.sent5: The concept of preformationists made her see life as a series of predetermined events.
